greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = the first odious number encountered when starting from k = n and iterating the map k -> A003188(A006068(k)/2).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: If A010060(n) = 1 [when n is one of the odious numbers, A000069], then a(n) = n, otherwise a(n) = a(A003188(A006068(n)/2)).
If A010060(n) = 0 [when n is one of the evil numbers, A001969], then a(n)= a(A000265(n)) [the trailing zeros in binary expansion of n do not affect the result].
For all n >= 1, a(A000069(n)) = A000069(n). [By definition].
xref: Cf. A277808 (gives the number of such iterations needed to reach a(n) from n).
Cf. A003945 (the positions of 1's in this sequence).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 03 2016
